value.title: Is This AI and Robotics Chip Stock a Buy Now?
value.excerpt: Teradyne sounds like a great little AI and robotics stock for chips and industrial automation alike, but it's not all rosy. Like any manufacturing business, Teradyne can go through some nasty cyclical downturns. That's exactly what is transpiring right now.

value.title: Taiwan’s TSMC to invest $2.9 billion in new plant as demand for AI chips soars
value.excerpt: TSMC, the world’s largest chipmaker, says it plans to invest nearly 90 billion New Taiwan dollars ($2.9 billion) to build an advanced chip plant in Taiwan, as it expands production to meet booming demand for artificial intelligence (AI) products.

value.title: TSMC to invest $2.9 billion in advanced chip packaging plant in Taiwan
value.excerpt: TSMC, the world's largest chip maker, plans to invest about $2.87 billion in an advanced chip packaging plant in Taiwan.

value.title: Nvidia could mint $300 billion in AI revenues by 2027, 10 times the expected takings this year, analyst says
value.excerpt: Mizuho analyst Vijay Rakesh expects the company to generate $25 billion to $30 billion in AI revenues this year.

value.title: Cadence lifts revenue forecast as AI boom boosts chip-design demand
value.excerpt: Cadence Design Systems Inc on Monday raised its full-year revenue forecast slightly above Wall Street estimates, as a surge in artificial intelligence (AI) innovation fueled demand for custom semiconductor design.

value.title: Lam Is an Underappreciated AI Chip Play. Here’s Why.
value.excerpt: Advanced memory technology may be an underestimated beneficiary of the increased spending on artificial intelligence.

value.title: Nvidia is ‘dominating’ and could unlock $300 billion in AI revenue by 2027, analyst says
value.excerpt: A Mizuho analyst is feeling even more bullish on Nvidia's stock prospects as he thinks about the AI opportunities ahead of the chip giant.

value.title: Musk Says Tesla Would Buy More Nvidia AI Chips, If Only Nvidia Had Enough of Them
value.excerpt: Later in the call, Musk expanded on those comments, doling out praise for Nvidia and its co-founder and CEO Jensen Huang:

value.title: Australian DishBrain researchers receive more than $400K to merge AI with human brain cells
value.excerpt: Researchers in southern Australia have recently been granted more than $403,000 in funding to merge human brain cells with artificial intelligence technology.

value.title: Here Are the Actual Mechanics Behind Powering AI
value.excerpt: He walks us through the infrastructure involved in powering AI, how difficult it is to get chips right now, who has them, and how the landscape might change in the future. This transcript has been lightly edited for clarity.

value.title: AMD's Best Bet on AI Might Not Be What You Think
value.excerpt: But FPGAs are a big bet on AI, too, and still get little love from the investor community. The addition of Xilinx remade AMD's embedded segment into a high-growth powerhouse that raked in over $1.5 billion in sales last quarter.

value.title: TSMC says skilled worker shortage delays start of Arizona chip production
value.excerpt: Shares of Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co slumped more than 3% Friday after the world’s largest contract chipmaker flagged a 10% drop in 2023 sales and said production due to start next year at its first plant in Arizona would be delayed.

value.title: AI Alone Can’t Save the Chip Industry From a Downturn
value.excerpt: PCs, smartphones and memory still account for most of chip production and remain in a slump.

value.title: Computer chip with built-in human brain tissue gets military funding
value.excerpt: Monash University scientists created the "DishBrain" – a semi-biological computer chip with some 800,000 human and mouse brain cells lab-grown into its electrodes. Demonstrating something like sentience,

value.title: Tenstorrent Is Changing the Way We Think About AI Chips
value.excerpt: “GPUs are essentially at the end of their evolutionary curve,” Ljubisa Bajic, CEO of AI chip startup Tenstorrent told Design News. “[GPUs] have done a great job; they’ve pushed the field to to the point where it is now. But in order to make any ...

value.title: U.S. Tech Leaders Aim for Fewer Export Curbs on AI Chips for China
value.excerpt: The chip giant's product launch on July 11 is part of an effort by U.S. technology companies to bypass or curb government export controls to the Chinese market as the U.S. government, citing national security concerns, continues to tighten restrictions on China's artificial intelligence industry.

value.title: AI LLM on flagship devices might be possible with new Qualcomm chip
value.excerpt: Future Qualcomm processors might provide AI LLM on flagship devices for end users, and this will have some benefits.

value.title: US chip curbs are scaring venture capital firms from Chinese AI start-ups, but not us, says BlueRun Ventures China
value.excerpt: AI development in China could be difficult in the near term, but that problem can be solved in the long run, says BRV China managing partner Jui Tan.

value.title: AI, Big Tech And Blue Chips: These 3 Charts Signal Shift In The Market
value.excerpt: One of the most popular ETFs investing in AI-driven equities, the Global X Artificial Intelligence & Technology ETF AIQ -2.75% + Free Alerts , fell 2.7% in a single day, marking its second-worst performance since the start of the year.

value.title: TSMC delays US chip fab opening, says US talent is insufficient
value.excerpt: The Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC) was supposed to have its first Arizona chip factory operational by late 2024 but now has confirmed significant delays. Primarily due to a shortage of technical workers with critical expertise in the US, TSMC projects to finish construction instead by 2025.

value.title: Chip Giant AMD Says AI To Be 'Mega-trend' For Computing World
value.excerpt: AI will be the "defining mega-trend" for the global computing industry, the head of chip giant AMD said Thursday in Taiwan, where the majority of the world's semiconductors powering the technology is produced.

value.title: Corporate earnings season heating up, TSMC outlook adding concerns to AI and chip names
value.excerpt: - Industrials: Saab [SAABB.SE] +3.5% (Q2 results), Electrolux [ELUXB.SE] -15.0% (earnings; starts preparations for a potential divestment of Zanussi and other non-core brands during the coming years which could be valued at SEK10B in total), Volvo Cars [VOLCARB.SE] -1.0% (Q2 results), Alfa Laval [ALFA.SE] +6.0% (Q2 results).

value.title: Taiwan’s export orders slump for 10th straight month in June, Taipei pins hopes on AI demand
value.excerpt: Taiwan’s export orders fell by 24.9 per cent from a year ago in June, but Taipei expects improvements in the second half of the year due to the growing demand for its artificial intelligence (AI) supply chain.

value.title: AI Growth Lifts Quanta’s Barry Lam To No. 1 Among Taiwan’s Richest
value.excerpt: Lam, who founded Quanta in 1988 when Taiwan was disparagingly known as a “clone kingdom” for IBM PC knockoffs, was worth $9.2 billion on the list yesterday, compared with $5.6 billion on the 2023 Forbes Taiwan Rich List published in April. Lam has topped Zhang Congyuan, who at No. 2 has a fortune worth $7.7 billion.

value.title: China Diplomat warns Washington of further restrictions on investment, AI chips
value.excerpt: China's Ambassador to Washington Xie Feng crossed wires late Wednesday, via Reuters, while speaking at the Aspen Security Forum where he criticized the US consideration for review of the outbound investment about China and further curbs on AI chips to the Asian nation.

value.title: How to Build the Ultimate GPU Cloud to Power AI
value.excerpt: Connecting decision makers to a dynamic network of information, people and ideas, Bloomberg quickly and accurately delivers business and financial information, news and insight around the world

value.title: ‘Crazy Times’: Elon Musk Reacts To Tech Stocks’ Latest AI Surge
value.excerpt: AI mania on Wall Street has helped Tesla stock surge more than 170% this year and made Elon Musk more than $100 billion richer.

value.title: 2 Top AI Stocks Ready for a Bull Run
value.excerpt: Semiconductor companies will play a central role in adopting AI as advanced chips are needed to train large language models and also for running inferences on the trained models. For instance, OpenAI's popular chatbot, ChatGPT, was reportedly trained using more than 30,000 graphics processing units from Nvidia.

value.title: UN warns of AI brain chips ‘on steroids’ that could control minds
value.excerpt: A paralysed man walked for the first time in 12 years after being fitted with a pioneering mind-reading implant (Picture: EPFL) The United Nations (UN) has warned about the potential dangers of implanting artificial intelligence (AI) chips in the brain ...

value.title: Nvidia: A Journey Towards $380 Billion In Revenue With GPU, AI, And FSD
value.excerpt: Nvidia Corporation is expected to reach $380 billion in revenue by 2032, driven by accelerated computing and AI. Find out why I am bullish on NVDA stock.
